column4: doh. one problem encounter so far. it is a debian installer problem and not a ubuntu problem though
well two. installer does not ask for the essid when setting up a wireless network and two the grub config tool did not automatically find my openbsd installation.
the new grub-setup tool in slackware current does find and name my openbsd partition correctly in menu.lst
it tries the 'any' essid first, and if that works it just goes ahead and uses it
the code to detect BSD filesystems just doesn't exist right now, I'm afraid
Alastair McKinstry started to write it but apparently never finished
well you might be right there. my nieghbor has a wap up and is not wep and dhcp so that might conflicted with mine
I'll have to have a look at grub-setup then and see if we can use its code in os-prober
i am going to tell him sooner or later about fixing his netowrk
it is in slack so no idea
any idea where I can find it? I don't know slackware

ok i found out they do not use their own tool but rather a tool from someone else. you can find that said tool here: http://www.tux.org/pub/people/kent-robotti/looplinux/index.html - grubconfig is at the bottom
